snippet: The review includes how the government deals with hostage’s relatives, but a prohibition on paying ransom is not being reconsidered.
abstract: Obama administration will review its policy on securing the release of United States citizens taken hostage abroad, though strict ban on paying ransoms will remain in place; review comes as administration grapples with series of beheadings of American captives by the Islamic State militant group.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.
